page.title: 13CIVIC AMENITY SITE, HESSLE
page.content: The site is used for the disposal of household refuse from the surrounding area. The site, above the Humberfield Quarry, consists of nine containers and three compactors. The containers are six metres long, two and a half metres tall and hold fifteen tons of waste each. The site handles 300 tons of waste per week. The electrically- powered compactors compress the waste at a pressure of 2,800lbs/sq.in., causing the waste to be forced to the back of the containers. There are separate containers for soil and rubble, metal, waste oil and large household items. Bottles are collected according to their colour in "bottle banks", and there is another container for metal cans. This is so that they may be re-cycled. Once the containers for waste are full they are taken down to the landfill site for disposal.
